POLICY ON PRESERVATION OF DOCUMENTS

{/* Section 1: Background */}

1. Background

Pursuant to Regulation 9 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India ("SEBI") (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, as amended ("Listing Regulations"), every listed company shall formulate a policy on preservation of documents ("Policy") which has to be approved by the board of directors. The Board of Directors of Uma Exports Limited ("Company"), at its meeting held on July 07, 2021, approved this Policy. This Policy will be effective from July 07, 2021.

{/* Section 2: Definitions */}

2. Definitions

  • 2.1 "Act" means the Companies Act, 2013, Rules framed thereunder and any amendments thereto.
  • 2.2 "Applicable Law" means any law, rules, circulars, guidelines or standards under which the preservation of the Documents has been prescribed.
  • 2.3 "Authorised Person" means any person duly authorised by Managing Director.
  • 2.4 "Board" means the Board of directors of the Company or any of its Committee.
  • 2.5 "Books of Account" includes records maintained in respect of all sums of money received and expended by a company, sales and purchases of goods and services, assets and liabilities of the company, and prescribed cost items.
  • 2.6 "Company" means Uma Exports Limited.
  • 2.7 "Current Document(s)" means any Document that has ongoing relevance in matters such as litigation, contracts, complaints, disputes, etc.
  • 2.8 "Document" means any summons, notice, requisition, order, declaration, form, register, whether maintained on paper or in electronic form.
  • 2.9 "Electronic Record(s)" refers to the electronic record defined under the Information Technology Act, 2000.
  • 2.10 "Electronic Form" refers to any device or system for storage and retrieval, including but not limited to computers, disks, cloud storage, etc.
  • 2.11 "Maintenance" refers to keeping documents, either physically or electronically.
  • 2.12 "Preservation" refers to keeping documents in good order and preventing damage or destruction.
  • 2.13 "Register" refers to documents and records required to be maintained under various Acts and regulations.
  • 2.14 "Records" means documentary evidence of past events or transactions.
  • 2.15 "Regulations" means the Securities Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligation and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.
{/* Section 3: Coverage */}

3. Coverage

This Policy is intended to guide the Company and its officers on maintenance of any Documents, their preservation, and disposal.

{/* Section 4: Classification */}

4. Classification

The preservation of Documents shall be done in the following manner:

  • Where a period for preservation is prescribed by Applicable Law, the Document will be preserved for that period.
  • Where no such period is prescribed, the Document will be preserved as long as it pertains to a matter which is covered under the definition of current documents.
{/* Section 5: Modes of Preservation */}

5. Modes of Preservation

The Documents may be preserved in physical or electronic form.

{/* Section 6: Custody of the Documents */}

6. Custody of the Documents

The custody of the Documents shall be with the Authorised Person. In the event of a resignation or transfer, the Authorised Person shall hand over all relevant Documents, and the new person shall take necessary actions such as changing passwords.

{/* Section 7: Authority for Approval of Policy */}

7. Authority for Approval of Policy

The Board shall have the authority to approve this policy in pursuance of the Regulations.

{/* Section 8: Authority to Make Alterations to the Policy */}

8. Authority to Make Alterations to the Policy

The Managing Director is authorized to make such alterations to this Policy as deemed necessary, in accordance with the provisions of the Act and other applicable laws.

{/* Section 9: Destruction of Documents */}

9. Destruction of Documents

The period stated for document retention is the minimum. Before destruction, the retention schedule may be reviewed by the Authorised Person. Temporary Documents, excluding Current Documents, will be destroyed after the prescribed period with prior approval from the Finance Committee.

{/* Section 10: Maintenance of Documents in Indexed Form */}

10. Maintenance of Documents in Indexed Form

For ease of reference, Documents shall be indexed either physically or electronically and kept updated by the Authorised Person.

{/* Section 11: Conversion of the Form in which the Documents are Preserved */}

11. Conversion of the Form in which the Documents are Preserved

Physical Documents may be converted to electronic form for easier maintenance and efficient space utilization.

{/* Section 12: Interpretation */}

12. Interpretation

In cases where the terms of this policy conflict with any newly enacted law, regulation, or standard, the law, rule, or regulation will take precedence until this policy is updated to conform.

{/* Annexure I: List of Documents to be Maintained */}

Annexure I: List of Documents to be Maintained

  • The original signed and stamped Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company.
  • Minutes of general meetings, board meetings, and committee meetings.
  • Register of members along with index.
  • Register of loans, guarantees, security, and acquisitions made by the Company.
  • Register of investments not held in the Company's name.
  • Register of contracts with related parties.
  • Register of charges.
  • Register of directors and Key Managerial Personnel.
